Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

sap.ui.vk.ListPanelStack.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ListPanelStack. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getExpanded expanded} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getExpandAnimation expandAnimation} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getCollapsible collapsible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.vk.ListPanel[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

destroyContent.!description: Destroys all the content in the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

insertContent.!description: Inserts a content into the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.vk.ListPanel, description: The content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

setExpanded.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getExpanded expanded}. Expansion state When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bExpanded: type: boolean, description: New value for property expanded

setCollapsible.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getCollapsible collapsible}. Ability to collapse When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bCollapsible: type: boolean, description: New value for property collapsible

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}. Control width Default value is 100%.

setExpandAnimation.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getExpandAnimation expandAnimation}. Expand animation When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bExpandAnimation: type: boolean, description: New value for property expandAnimation

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. Control width When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 100%.

sap.ui.vk.dvl.Viewport.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Viewport. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowAllHotspots showAllHotspots} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getHotspotColorABGR hotspotColorABGR} : int (default: 3221225727)
    • {@link #getHotspotColor hotspotColor} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.7529411764705882))
    • {@link #getBackgroundColorTopABGR backgroundColorTopABGR} : int (default: 4278190080)
    • {@link #getBackgroundColorBottomABGR backgroundColorBottomABGR} : int (default: 4294967295)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:pan pan} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:zoom zoom} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:rotate rotate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:frameRenderingFinished frameRenderingFinished} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.ViewportBase#constructor sap.ui.vk.ViewportBase} can be used as well.

getViewInfo.!description: Retrieves information about the current camera view in the scene, and saves the information in a JSON-like object. The information can then be used at a later time to restore the scene to the same camera view using the {@link sap.ui.vk.Viewport#setViewInfo setViewInfo} method.

parameters.query: type: object, description: Query object which indicates what information to be retrieved.

getBackgroundColorTopABGR.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getBackgroundColorTopABGR backgroundColorTopABGR}. Viewport background top color in the ABGR format Default value is 4278190080.

attachPan.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:pan pan} event of this sap.ui.vk.dvl.Viewport. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vk.dvl.Viewport itself.

sap.ui.vk.RedlineElement.!constructorDescription:
Base class for redline elements such as {sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementRectangle}, {sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementEllipse}, {sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementFreehand}, {sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementText}. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getElementId elementId} : string
    • {@link #getOriginX originX} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getOriginY originY} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getOpacity opacity} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getStrokeWidth strokeWidth} : float (default: 2)
    • {@link #getStrokeColor strokeColor} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: #e6600d)
    • {@link #getStrokeDashArray strokeDashArray} : float[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getHalo halo} : boolean (default: false)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.vk.FlexibleControlLayoutData.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FlexibleControlLayoutData. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSize size} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: auto)
    • {@link #getMinSize minSize} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 0px)
    • {@link #getMarginTop marginTop} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 0px)
    • {@link #getMarginBottom marginBottom} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 0px)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.LayoutData#constructor sap.ui.core.LayoutData} can be used as well.

getMinSize.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMinSize minSize}. Sets the minimum size of the content in px. Default value is 0px.

setMarginBottom.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMarginBottom marginBottom}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0px.

parameters.sMarginBottom: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property marginBottom

setMinSize.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMinSize minSize}. Sets the minimum size of the content in px. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0px.

parameters.sMinSize: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property minSize

getMarginTop.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMarginTop marginTop}. Sets the margin-bottom of the content in px. Default value is 0px.

getSize.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSize size}. Sets the size of the content. Default value is auto.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.vk.FlexibleControlLayoutData.

parameters.procedureIndex: type: number, description: Optional integer representing the index of the target procedure in the procedures list.

parameters.oStepInfoPopup: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The stepInfoPopup to set

attachStepChanged.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:stepChanged stepChanged} event of this sap.ui.vk.StepNavigation. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vk.StepNavigation itself. Raised each time a step starts, changes, or finishes.
attachStepChanged.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.vk.StepNavigation

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.vk.StepNavigation itself

parameters.oProcedureItemTemplate: type: sap.ui.core.Item, description: The procedureItemTemplate to set

getSettings.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSettings settings}.

Managed settings and properties for Step Navigation events.

getStep.!description: Gets a step based on a positive or negative integer, which is used as an index relative to the index of the current step. An index value of 0 can be used to retrieve the details of the current step.
getStep.!type: fn(relIndex: Number, procedureIndex?: Number, specificStepId: String) -> JSON

parameters.relIndex: type: number, description: Positive or negative integer representing the number to add or subtract from the index of the current step to return the desired step; for example, //next 1, current 0, previous -1
parameters.procedureIndex: type: number, description: Optional integer representing the index of the target procedure in the procedures list.
parameters.specificStepId: type: string, description: The ID of the step that we want to retrieve.

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}. Width of the Step Navigation control. Default value is 100%.

refresh.!description: Rebuilds the content of the Step Navigation control from the current Scene.

parameters.oScene: type: object, description: The scene object to be used.

sap.ui.vk.StepNavigation.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new StepNavigation. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSettings settings} : object
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getShowThumbnails showThumbnails} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowToolbar showToolbar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowStepInfo showStepInfo} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getProcedureItemTemplate procedureItemTemplate} : sap.ui.core.Item
    • {@link #getStepInfoPopup stepInfoPopup} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getLayout layout} : sap.m.Toolbar
    • {@link #getThumbnailsContainer thumbnailsContainer} : sap.m.ScrollContainer
  • Associations
    • {@link #getContentConnector contentConnector} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:resize resize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:stepChanged stepChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getProceduresAndSteps.!description: Returns the procedures list with steps for the current scene, and appends base64 data as thumbnailData and an image type as thumbnailType.

setShowToolbar.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowToolbar showToolbar}. Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display a toolbar. If set to true, then the toolbar is rendered. If set to false, then the toolbar is hidden. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowToolbar: type: boolean, description: New value for property showToolbar

getShowThumbnails.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowThumbnails showThumbnails}. Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display thumbnails. If set to true, then thumbnails are rendered. If set to false, then thumbnails are hidden. Default value is true.

destroyProcedureItemTemplate.!description: Destroys the procedureItemTemplate in the aggregation {@link #getProcedureItemTemplate procedureItemTemplate}.

parameters.oContentConnector: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector, description: ID of an element which becomes the new target of this contentConnector association; alternatively, an element instance may be given

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property height

setScene.!description: Attaches a Scene object to the Step Navigation control so that it can access the Scene’s procedures and steps.

detachResize.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:resize resize} event of this sap.ui.vk.StepNavigation. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

If set to false, the popup is hidden. Default value is false.

Default value is true.

sap.ui.vk.DecryptionHandler.!description:
Contract for objects that implement decryption.

An interface for an object provided by an application to decrypt content of encrypted models.

Content is encrypted with the {@link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advanced_Encryption_Standard AES128} algorithm in the {@link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Block_cipher_mode_of_operation#Cipher_Block_Chaining_.28CBC.29 CBC} mode.

A key is derived with the {@link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PBKDF2 PBKDF2} algorithm by applying the {@link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hash-based_message_authentication_code HMAC}-{@link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SHA-2 SHA256} function 10,000 times.

sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManagerBase.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ViewStateManagerBase. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShouldTrackVisibilityChanges shouldTrackVisibilityChanges} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getRecursiveSelection recursiveSelection} : boolean (default: false)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getContentConnector contentConnector} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:visibilityChanged visibilityChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectionChanged selectionChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:opacityChanged opacityChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:tintColorChanged tintColorChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:nodeHierarchyReplaced nodeHierarchyReplaced} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:highlightColorChanged highlightColorChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.vk.tools.RotateTurntableTool.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RotateTurntableTool tool. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Events
    • {@link #event:rotate rotate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool#constructor sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool} can be used as well.

getScene.!description: Gets the Scene object the node hierarchy belongs to.

parameters.layerProxy: type: sap.ui.vk.LayerProxy, description: The layer proxy object.

enumerateAncestors.!description:
Enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function, to which it passes the ancestor nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to callback are temporary objects, they are reset after each call to the callback function.
The ancestor nodes are enumerated starting from the top level node, and progresses down the node hierarchy.
enumerateAncestors.!type: fn(nodeRef: Object, callback: fn(), passNodeRef?: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.dvl.NodeHierarchy

parameters.callback: type: function, description: A function to call when the ancestor nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.dvl.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.
parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The node reference whose ancestor nodes we want enumerated.
parameters.passNodeRef:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to pass the node references of the ancestor nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.

getAncestors.!description: Returns a list of IDs belonging to the ancestors of a particular node.

parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The node reference of the node whose ancestors will be returned.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.vk.dvl.NodeHierarchy with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata
parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

getSceneRef.!description: Gets the scene reference that this NodeHierarchy object wraps.

getChildren.!description: Returns a list of IDs belonging to the children of a particular node.

parameters.stepIntoClosedNodes: type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to return only the child nodes of a closed node or not. If true, then the children of that closed node will be returned. If false, then the children of that closed node will not be returned.
parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The node reference of the node whose children will be returned. If nodeRef is not passed to the getChildren function, the IDs of the root nodes will be returned.

getGraphicsCore.!description: Gets the GraphicsCore object this Scene object belongs to.

sap.ui.vk.dvl.NodeHierarchy.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new NodeHierarchy.

The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created via a call to
{@link sap.ui.vk.Scene#getDefaultNodeHierarchy sap.ui.vk.Scene.getDefaultNodeHierarchy}.

createNodeCopy.!description: Creates a copy of an existing node.
createNodeCopy.!type: fn(nodeToCopy: Object, parentNode: Object, name: String, insertBeforeNode: Object) -> Object

parameters.parentNode: type: any, description: The reference to the parent node where the created node is added to. If equals null the newly created node is a top level node.
parameters.name: type: string, description: The name of the new node.
parameters.nodeToCopy: type: any, description: The reference to the node to copy.
parameters.insertBeforeNode: type: any, description: The created node is added before this specified node. If equals null the newly created node is added at the end of the parent's list of nodes.

findNodesByName.!description: Finds nodes in a scene via node name.

getLayers.!description: Returns a list of layer IDs.

sap.ui.vk.dvl.NodeHierarchy.!description:
Provides the ability to explore a Scene object's node structure.

The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created via a call to {@link sap.ui.vk.Scene#getDefaultNodeHierarchy sap.ui.vk.Scene.getDefaultNodeHierarchy}.

createLayerProxy.!description:
Creates a layer proxy object.

The layer proxy object must be destroyed with the {@link #destroyLayerProxy destroyLayerProxy} method.

parameters.layerId: type: string, description: The layer ID for which to create a proxy object.

createNode.!type: fn(parentNode: Object, name: String, insertBeforeNode: Object) -> Object

parameters.parentNode: type: any, description: The parent node reference where the created node is added to. If equals null the newly created node is a top level node.
parameters.name: type: string, description: The name of the new node.
parameters.insertBeforeNode: type: any, description: The created node is added before this specified node. If equals null the newly created node is added at the end of the parent's list of nodes.

getHotspotNodeIds.!description: Returns a list of hotspot IDs.

parameters.nodeProxy: type: sap.ui.vk.dvl.NodeProxy, description: The node proxy object.

removeNode.!description: Deletes a node and destroys it.

parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The reference to a node or an array of nodes to destroy.

enumerateChildren.!description:
Enumerates the child nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method gets the child nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function to which it passes the child nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to the callback fuction are temporary objects, which are reset after each call to the callback function.
enumerateChildren.!type: fn(nodeRef?: Object, callback: fn(), stepIntoClosedNodes?: Boolean, passNodeRef?: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.dvl.NodeHierarchy

parameters.stepIntoClosedNodes:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to enumerate the child nodes if the node is closed.
If true, the children of that closed node will be enumerated
If false, the children of that node will not be enumerated
parameters.callback: type: function, description: A function to call when the child nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.dvl.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.
parameters.nodeRef:
type: any, description: The node reference whose child nodes we want enumerated.
When nodeRef is specified, the child nodes of this node are enumerated.
When no nodeRef is specified, only the top level nodes are enumerated.
parameters.passNodeRef:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to pass the node references of the child nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the child nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies created from the child node references are passed to the callback function.

createNodeProxy.!description:
Creates a node proxy object.

The node proxy object must be destroyed with the {@link #destroyNodeProxy destroyNodeProxy} method.

parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The node reference for which to create a proxy object.

sap.ui.vk.Overlay.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Overlay. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getZoomOnResize zoomOnResize} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAreas areas} : sap.ui.vk.OverlayArea[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getTarget target} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:click click} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contextMenu contextMenu} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

setZoomOnResize.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getZoomOnResize zoomOnResize}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bZoomOnResize: type: boolean, description: New value for property zoomOnResize

insertArea.!description: Inserts a area into the aggregation {@link #getAreas areas}.

parameters.oArea: type: sap.ui.vk.OverlayArea, description: The area to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the area should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the area is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the area is inserted at the last position

addArea.!description: Adds some area to the aggregation {@link #getAreas areas}.

parameters.oArea: type: sap.ui.vk.OverlayArea, description: The area to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

removeAllAreas.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getAreas areas}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.vk.Overlay.

stopAdding.!description: Stops the mode for adding redlining, which begins when the {@link sap.ui.vk.RedlineDesign#startAdding startAdding} method is called.

startAdding.!description: Prepares the RedlineDesign control for adding a new instance of {sap.ui.vk.RedlineElement}.

sap.ui.vk.ViewportBase.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Viewport. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowDebugInfo showDebugInfo} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getBackgroundColorTop backgroundColorTop} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(50, 50, 50, 1))
    • {@link #getBackgroundColorBottom backgroundColorBottom} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(255, 255, 255, 1))
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getSelectionMode selectionMode} : sap.ui.vk.SelectionMode (default: Sticky)
    • {@link #getFreezeCamera freezeCamera} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getRenderMode renderMode} : sap.ui.vk.RenderMode (default: Default)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getContentConnector contentConnector} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector)
    • {@link #getViewStateManager viewStateManager} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager)
    • {@link #getTools tools} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool)[]
    • {@link #getAnimationTimeSlider animationTimeSlider} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.vk.AnimationTimeSlider)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:urlClicked urlClicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:nodeClicked nodeClicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:resize resize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:nodesPicked nodesPicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:nodeZoomed nodeZoomed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:viewActivated viewActivated} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:procedureFinished procedureFinished} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:viewFinished viewFinished} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getFreezeCamera.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFreezeCamera freezeCamera}. Freeze camera Default value is false.

attachNodesPicked.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:nodesPicked nodesPicked} event of this sap.ui.vk.ViewportBase. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vk.ViewportBase itself. This event is fired when nodes in the scene are picked by user action. If application requires different selection behaviour then it can handle this event and implement its own selection method. In this case {@link sap.ui.vk.Viewport#selectionMode selectionMode} property should be set to sap.ui.vk.SelectionMode.None Application can modify list of picked node references to alter selection behaviour.
attachNodesPicked.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.vk.ViewportBase

This event is fired when a node in the scene is zoomed in/out by double-clicking.

For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. addContentManagerResolver.!description:
Adds a new content manager resolver.

The last added resolver will be executed the first.

Content manager resolver analyzes the content resource definition and returns the type of the content manager to use for loading the content resource.

The simplest resolver tests the content resource source type. The test can be either a string comparison or a regular expression.

A more sofisticated resolver is a function that can use the full content resource definition to find a proper content manager dynamically, e.g. the resolver can use the 'HEAD' HTTP request to get the 'Content-Type' header to find out the type of the content resource.

parameters.resolver:
type: function|object, description: Object that defines how to find out the content manager class name.
If resolver is a function then this function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentResource sap.ui.vk.ContentResource} and returns a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise Promise} that resolves with an object with the following properties:
  • dimension - int - Dimension of the model. E.g. 2 or 3.
  • contentManagerClassName - string - Name of content manager class to use for loading the content resource.
  • settings - object - Optional settings specific to the content manager.
    See {@link sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager}.
If resolver is an object then it has the following properties.

attachContentChangesStarted.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:contentChangesStarted contentChangesStarted} event of this sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector itself. This event will be fired when content resource changes are about to be processed.
attachContentChangesStarted.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector

sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ContentConnector. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContentResources contentResources} : sap.ui.vk.ContentResource[] (default)
    • {@link #getViewStateManagers viewStateManagers} : sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:contentChangesStarted contentChangesStarted} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contentChangesFinished contentChangesFinished} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contentChangesProgress contentChangesProgress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contentReplaced contentReplaced} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contentDestroying contentDestroying} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.vk.threejs.DetailView.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DetailView. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getName name} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getCamera camera} : any
    • {@link #getType type} : sap.ui.vk.DetailViewType (default: DetailView)
    • {@link #getShape shape} : sap.ui.vk.DetailViewShape (default: Box)
    • {@link #getBorderWidth borderWidth} : float (default: 2)
    • {@link #getBackgroundColor backgroundColor} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: #fff)
    • {@link #getBorderColor borderColor} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: #000)
    • {@link #getRenderOrder renderOrder} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getOrigin origin} : any (default: new THREE.Vector3(0, 0))
    • {@link #getSize size} : any (default: new THREE.Vector3(0.5, 0.5))
    • {@link #getAttachmentPoint attachmentPoint} : any
    • {@link #getMetadata metadata} : any (default: [object Object])
    • {@link #getVeId veId} : any (default: [object Object])
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor sap.ui.base.ManagedObject} can be used as well.

getBorderColor.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getBorderColor borderColor}. Default value is #000.

getCamera.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getCamera camera}.

getName.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getName name}. Default value is empty string.

setName.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getName name}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

parameters.sName: type: string, description: New value for property name

sap.ui.vk.RedlineSurface.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RedlineSurface. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties

    • {@link #event:zoom zoom} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.vk.ContainerBase.!constructorDescription:
Abstract Constructor for a new Container. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowFullScreen showFullScreen} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowSettings showSettings} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowSelection showSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFullScreen fullScreen} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getAutoAdjustHeight autoAdjustHeight} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.vk.ContainerContent[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:contentChange contentChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:settingsPressed settingsPressed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties

Horizontal.!description: The field of view is bound to the width of the viewport.

sap.ui.vk.MapContainer.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new MapContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowNavbar showNavbar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowHome showHome} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowMapLayer showMapLayer} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowRectangularZoom showRectangularZoom} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowZoom showZoom} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getListPanelStack listPanelStack} : sap.ui.vk.ListPanelStack
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.ContainerBase#constructor sap.ui.vk.ContainerBase} can be used as well.

parameters.oListPanelStack: type: sap.ui.vk.ListPanelStack, description: The listPanelStack to set

destroyListPanelStack.!description: Destroys the listPanelStack in the aggregation {@link #getListPanelStack listPanelStack}.

showSceneTree.!description: Shows or hides the scene tree control

colorSelect.!description: The select color of the OverlayArea in case selection highligthing is desired.

showZoom.!description: Controls the visibility of the zoom buttons

fullScreen.!description: Controls whether the control is show fullscreen or embedded

backgroundColorTop.!description: Viewport background top color in the CSS Color format

enableSceneTree.!description: Disables the scene tree control Button on the menu

showHome.!description: Controls the visibility of the home button

textDirection.!description: Specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options (RTL or LTR). By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

titleTextDirection.!description: Defines the title text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

showFullScreen.!description: Show fullscreen toggle button in toolbar

nodeInfos.!description: Array of objects containing node information. nodeRef - required node reference (String), transform - optional transformation matrix [Array of 12 Numbers], visibility - optional (Boolean)

showValue.!description: Indicates whether the displayValue should be shown in the ProgressIndicator.

shouldTrackVisibilityChanges.!description: Whether or not we want ViewStateManager to keep track of visibility changes.

diffuseColour.!description: Diffuse colour (optional) - red, green, blue, and alhpa

showAllHotspots.!description: Enables or disables showing of all hotspots

sap.ui.vk.!description: SAPUI5 library with controls for displaying 3D models.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

colorToCSSColor.!description: Converts a JSON structure { red, green, blue, alpha } to a {@link https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-color/#colorunits CSS Color} string.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.

settings.!description: Managed settings and properties for Step Navigation events.

playbacks.!description: Array of objects containing playback information. All required: sequenceId (string), playbackSpeed (float), playbackPreDelay (float), playbackPostDelay (float), playbackRepeat - required (int), playbackReversed (Boolean)

unread.!description: Activates the unread indicator for the list item, if set to true. Note: This flag is ignored when the showUnread property of the parent is set to false.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

tintColorABGR.!description:
The tint color.
The tint color is a 32-bit integer in the ABGR notation, where A is amount of blending between material color and tint color.

uvVerticalTilingEnabled.!description: Is the uv vertical tiling enabled

showStepNavigationThumbnails.!description: Shows or hides the Step Navigation thumbnails

localMatrix.!description: The local transformation matrix of the node.

description.!description: Defines the additional information for the title. Note: This is only visible when the title property is not empty.

hotspotColorABGR.!description: Color used for highlighting Smart2D hotspots in the ABGR format.

recursiveSelection.!description: Whether or not we want ViewStateManager to have recursive selection.

key.!description: Unique identifier for the object. This is optional. If not provided the default identifier sId is used. However, sId is generated if template binding is used and thus it is not stable. Provide the key if the object really needs a unique and stable identifier.

enabled.!description: Switches enabled state of the control. Disabled fields have different colors, and cannot be focused.

infoTextDirection.!description: Defines the info directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

marginTop.!description: Sets the margin-bottom of the content in px.

iconDensityAware.!description: By default, one or more requests are sent to get the density perfect version of the icon if the given version of the icon doesn't exist on the server. Note: If bandwidth is a key factor for the application, set this value to false.

select.!description: set to true if the element is selected

size.!description: Sets the size of the content.

worldMatrix.!description: The world transformation matrix of the node.

activeIcon.!description: Defines the icon that is shown while the list item is pressed.

semanticSpotType.!description: The semantic spot type for the legend marker.

emissiveColour.!description: Emissive colour (optional) - red, green, blue, and alhpa

sourceId.!description: The unique ID of the content resource.

runtimeSettings.!description:
Optional Emscripten runtime module settings. A JSON object with the following properties:
  • totalMemory {int} size of Emscripten module memory in bytes, default value: 512 MB.
  • logElementId {string} ID of a textarea DOM element to write the log to.
  • statusElementId {string} ID of a DOM element to write the status messages to.
Emscripten runtime module settings cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized.

showThumbnails.!description: Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display thumbnails. If set to true, then thumbnails are rendered. If set to false, then thumbnails are hidden.

activateView.!description: Optional parameter with view id which shall be activated when scene is loaded.

enableOverlay.!description: Enables or disables the Overlay control

counter.!description: Defines the counter value of the list items.

displayOnly.!description: Determines whether the control is in display-only state where the control has different visualization and cannot be focused.

showRectangularZoom.!description: Controls the visibility of the rectangular zoom button

source.!description: The source URL or the {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File File} object of the content resource/file to load from. The source may be omitted if a grouping node is needed.

color.!description: The fill color of the OverlayArea.

specularColour.!description: Specular colour (optional) - red, green, blue, and alhpa

showAnimationTimeSlider.!description: Indicates that the View Gallery control should display animation slider showing time of animation in current view.

highlightText.!description: Defines the semantics of the {@link sap.m.ListItemBase#setHighlight highlight} property for accessibility purposes.

fov.!description: Camera frustum field of view in degree

infoState.!description: Defines the state of the information text, e.g. Error, Warning, Success.

uvHorizontalTilingEnabled.!description: Is the uv horizontal tiling enabled

getCore.!description: Retrieve the {@link sap.ui.vk.Core Core} instance for the current window.

highlight.!description: Defines the highlight state of the list items. Valid values for the highlight property are values of the enumerations {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType} or {@link sap.ui.core.IndicationColor}. Accessibility support is provided through the associated {@link sap.m.ListItemBase#setHighlightText highlightText} property. If the highlight property is set to a value of {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType}, the highlightText property does not need to be set because a default text is used. However, the default text can be overridden by setting the highlightText property. In all other cases the highlightText property must be set.

hotspotColor.!description: Color used for highlighting Smart2D hotspots in the CSS Color format.

cssColorToColor.!description: Converts a {@link https://www.w3.org/TR/css3-color/#colorunits CSS Color} string to a JSON structure { red, green, blue, alpha }.

enableStepNavigation.!description: Disables the Step Navigation Control Button on the menu

veIds.!description: The node VE IDs. This property is read-only.

useSecureConnection.!description: If set to false, unsecure connections will be used. Default: true.

showDebugInfo.!description: Shows or hides the debug info.

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

showToolbar.!description: Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display a toolbar. If set to true, then the toolbar is rendered. If set to false, then the toolbar is hidden.

showMapLayer.!description: Controls the visibility of the Map Layer Select

webGLContextAttributes.!description:
Optional WebGL context attributes. A JSON object with the following boolean properties:
  • antialias {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will attempt to perform antialiased rendering if possible.
  • alpha {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will have an alpha (transparency) channel.
  • premultipliedAlpha {boolean} default value false. If set to true, the color channels in the framebuffer will be stored premultiplied by the alpha channel to improve performance.
Other {@link https://www.khronos.org/registry/webgl/specs/latest/1.0/#5.2 WebGL context attributes} are also supported. WebGL context attributes cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized.

sap.ui.vk.!helpDescription: SAPUI5 library with controls for displaying 3D models.

ambientColour.!description: Ambient colour (optional) - red, green, blue, and alhpa

title.!description: Used to set the title of the Toolbar

closed.!description: The indicator showing if the node is closed. This property is read-only.

sourceType.!description:
The source type of the content resource. Valid types:
  • vds
  • svg
  • png
  • jpg
  • jpeg
  • gif
  • bmp
  • tif
  • tiff
  • stream
The source type may be omitted if this is a grouping content node.

showStepNavigation.!description: Shows or hides the Step Navigation Control

iconInset.!description: Defines the indentation of the icon. If set to false, the icon will not be shown as embedded. Instead it will take the full height of the list item.

backgroundColorBottom.!description: Viewport background bottom color in the CSS Color format

adaptTitleSize.!description: By default, the title size adapts to the available space and gets bigger if the description is empty. If you have list items with and without descriptions, this results in titles with different sizes. In this case, it can be better to switch the size adaption off by setting this property to false.

showStepInfo.!description: Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display a popup containing information around the step that is playing. If set to true, then the popup is rendered. If set to false, the popup is hidden.

colorBorder.!description: The border color of the OverlayArea.

type.!description: Defines the visual indication and behavior of the list items, e.g. Active, Navigation, Detail.

password.!description: The password to use when opening the resource.

limitZoomOut.!description: Limit the abbility to zoom out. If enabled the zoom out stops if the image size reaches 25% of the full view (best fit).

enableProgressIndicator.!description: Enable / disable progress indicator for downloading and rendering VDS files

colorNonSelect.!description: The non-select color of the OverlayArea in case non-selection de-highligthing is desired.

includeAnimation.!description: Send structural data for animation objects, if false they will be omitted, reducing data size. Default: true.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

nodeMetadata.!description: The node metadata. This property is read-only.

lineColour.!description: Line colour (optional) - red, green, blue, and alhpa

displayValue.!description: Specifies the text value to be displayed in the bar.

abgrToColor.!description: Converts a 32-bit integer in the ABGR notation to a JSON structure { red, green, blue, alpha }.

metadataFilter.!description: Optional metadata filter that can trim the tree before sending to the client only keeping nodes that passed the filter and their parents. Default: null. Format: Comma-separated list of meta.category1.tag1.value1, meta.category2.tag2.value2. "meta." is the prefix and all metadata filters must start with it. Multiple filters are supported, they are combined using `OR` operator. Includes parent nodes of matching nodes (e.g. breadcrumb) even if they dont pass the filter.

minSize.!description: Sets the minimum size of the content in px.

cameraInfo.!description: Object containing camera info (optional) Perspective camera requires: type (String) must be "PerspectiveCamera", fov (Number), position [Array of 3 Numbers], nearClipPlane (Number), farClipPlane (Number), targetDirection - [Array of 3 Numbers], upDirection - [Array of 3 Numbers] Orthographic camera requires: type (String) must be "OrthographicCamera", nearClipPlane (Number), farClipPlane (Number), zoomFactor (Number), position [Array of 3 Numbers], targetDirection - [Array of 3 Numbers], upDirection - [Array of 3 Numbers]

hasChildren.!description: The indicator showing if the node has child nodes. This property is read-only.

percentValue.!description: Specifies the numerical value in percent for the length of the progress bar. Note: If a value greater than 100 is provided, the percentValue is set to 100. In other cases of invalid value, percentValue is set to its default of 0.

state.!description: Specifies the state of the bar. Enumeration sap.ui.core.ValueState provides Error, Warning, Success, Information, None (default value). The color for each state depends on the theme.

pushPMI.!description: If set to true, elements for PMI rendering content will be returned. Default: false.

veid.!description: Id of scene to retrieve tree for. Mandatory for the stream source type.

selected.!description: Defines the selected state of the list items. Note: Binding the selected property in single selection modes may cause unwanted results if you have more than one selected items in your binding.

deltaColorHot.!description: Color or color delta when object is hovered. Color deltas can be declared in the format RHLSA(<hue shift in degree>;<lightness multiplier>;<saturation multiplier>;<opacity multiplier>)

nodeRef.!description: The node reference. This property is read-only.

blocked.!description: Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

colorToABGR.!description: Converts a structure { red, green, blue, alpha } to a 32-bit integer in the ABGR notation.

pushViewGroups.!description: If set to true, infomation of view groups will be returned. Default: true.

enableLogger.!description: Optional boolean parameter to enable detailed logging. Can be used to track performance issues during data streaming from SAP 3D Visualisation Service.

includeHidden.!description: Send structural data for hidden objects, if false they will be omitted, reducing data size. Default: true.

changeable.!description: Set to true if OverlayArea is changeable.

setWebGLContextAttributes.!description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getWebGLContextAttributes webGLContextAttributes}. Optional WebGL context attributes. A JSON object with the following boolean properties:
  • antialias {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will attempt to perform antialiased rendering if possible.
  • alpha {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will have an alpha (transparency) channel.
  • premultipliedAlpha {boolean} default value false. If set to true, the color channels in the framebuffer will be stored premultiplied by the alpha channel to improve performance.
Other {@link https://www.khronos.org/registry/webgl/specs/latest/1.0/#5.2 WebGL context attributes} are also supported. WebGL context attributes cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is { antialias: true, alpha: true, premultipliedAlpha: false }.

sap.ui.vk.Viewer.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Viewer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnableOverlay enableOverlay} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableSceneTree enableSceneTree} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowSceneTree showSceneTree} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableStepNavigation enableStepNavigation} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableNotifications enableNotifications} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowStepNavigation showStepNavigation} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowStepNavigationThumbnails showStepNavigationThumbnails} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableToolbar enableToolbar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableProgressIndicator enableProgressIndicator} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getToolbarTitle toolbarTitle} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getShouldTrackVisibilityChanges shouldTrackVisibilityChanges} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getRecursiveSelection recursiveSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getRuntimeSettings runtimeSettings} : object (default: [object Object])
    • {@link #getWebGLContextAttributes webGLContextAttributes} : object (default: { antialias: true, alpha: true, premultipliedAlpha: false })
    • {@link #getShowAllHotspots showAllHotspots} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getHotspotColorABGR hotspotColorABGR} : int (default: 3221225727)
    • {@link #getHotspotColor hotspotColor} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.7529411764705882))
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContentResources contentResources} : sap.ui.vk.ContentResource[] (default)
    • {@link #getOverlay overlay} : sap.ui.vk.Overlay
  • Events
    • {@link #event:contentResourceChangesProcessed contentResourceChangesProcessed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:sceneLoadingSucceeded sceneLoadingSucceeded} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:sceneLoadingFailed sceneLoadingFailed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:sceneDestroying sceneDestroying} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectionChanged selectionChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:fullScreen fullScreen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:urlClicked urlClicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:nodeClicked nodeClicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

Disables the Step Navigation Control Button on the menu When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bEnableStepNavigation: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableStepNavigation

getWebGLContextAttributes.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getWebGLContextAttributes webGLContextAttributes}. Optional WebGL context attributes. A JSON object with the following boolean properties:
  • antialias {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will attempt to perform antialiased rendering if possible.
  • alpha {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will have an alpha (transparency) channel.
  • premultipliedAlpha {boolean} default value false. If set to true, the color channels in the framebuffer will be stored premultiplied by the alpha channel to improve performance.
Other {@link https://www.khronos.org/registry/webgl/specs/latest/1.0/#5.2 WebGL context attributes} are also supported. WebGL context attributes cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized. Default value is { antialias: true, alpha: true, premultipliedAlpha: false }.

Sets a new value for property {@link #getRuntimeSettings runtimeSettings}. Optional Emscripten runtime module settings. A JSON object with the following properties:
  • totalMemory {int} size of Emscripten module memory in bytes, default value: 512 MB.
  • logElementId {string} ID of a textarea DOM element to write the log to.
  • statusElementId {string} ID of a DOM element to write the status messages to.
Emscripten runtime module settings cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is [object Object].

sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool.!constructorDescription:
Base for all tool controls. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTargetViewportType targetViewportType} : any
    • {@link #getToolid toolid} : string
    • {@link #getActive active} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFootprint footprint} : string[]
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGizmo gizmo} : sap.ui.vk.tools.Gizmo
  • Associations
    • {@link #getGizmoContainer gizmoContainer} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:enabled enabled} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

parameters.oTargetViewportType: type: any, description: New value for property targetViewportType

getFootprint.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getFootprint footprint}.

Used to decide whether this tool should be enabled for the target viewport.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

enumerateAncestors.!description:
Enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function, to which it passes the ancestor nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to callback are temporary objects, they are reset after each call to the callback function.
The ancestor nodes are enumerated starting from the top level node, and progresses down the node hierarchy.
enumerateAncestors.!type: fn(nodeRef: Object, callback: fn(), passNodeRef?: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy

parameters.callback: type: function, description: A function to call when the ancestor nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.
parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The reference object of a node whose ancestor nodes we want enumerated.
parameters.passNodeRef:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to pass the reference objects of the ancestor nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the reference objects of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.

getChildren.!description: Returns a list of reference objects belonging to the children of a particular node.

parameters.stepIntoClosedNodes: type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to return only the child nodes of a closed node or not. If true, then the children of that closed node will be returned. If false, then the children of that closed node will not be returned.
parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The reference object of the node whose children will be returned. If nodeRef is not passed to the getChildren function, the reference objects of the root nodes will be returned.

enumerateChildren.!description:
Enumerates the child nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method gets the child nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function to which it passes the child nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to the callback fuction are temporary objects, which are reset after each call to the callback function.
enumerateChildren.!type: fn(nodeRef?: Object, callback: fn(), stepIntoClosedNodes?: Boolean, passNodeRef?: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy

parameters.stepIntoClosedNodes:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to enumerate the child nodes if the node is closed.
If true, the children of that closed node will be enumerated
If false, the children of that node will not be enumerated
parameters.callback: type: function, description: A function to call when the child nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.
parameters.nodeRef:
type: any, description: The reference object of a node whose child nodes we want enumerated.
When nodeRef is specified, the child nodes of this node are enumerated.
When no nodeRef is specified, only the top level nodes are enumerated.
parameters.passNodeRef:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to pass the reference objects of the child nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the reference objects of the child nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies created from the child reference objects are passed to the callback function.

findNodesByMetadata.!description: Finds nodes in a scene via metadata information.

parameters.query:
type: object, description: JSON object containing the search parameters.
The following example shows what the structure of the query object should look like: 
query = {
  category: string,
  key: string,
  value: string | string[],
  predicate: "equals" | "contains" | "startsWith",
  caseSensitive: true | false
}

NOTE: query.predicate and query.caseSensitive refer to query.value.
  • query.category
    A string indicating the name of the metadata category.
    If no value is specified for query.category, all nodes in the scene will be returned in the search.

  • query.key
    A string indicating the key which belongs to the metadata category specified in query.category. You can only use query.key if query.category has been specified.
    If no value is specified for query.key, then all nodes grouped under the specified category will be returned in the search.

  • query.value
    A string or an array of strings containing the value or values associated with query.key. You can only use query.value in the search if query.key has been specified.
    If no value is specified for query.value, then all nodes containing the specified key will be returned, regardless of what the value of the key is.
    The following example shows a single string being passed in: 
    value: "Box #14"
    The following example shows an array of strings being passed in: 
    value: ["Box #3", "box #4", "BOX #5"]
  • query.predicate
    Represents a search mode. The available search modes are "equals", "contains", and "startsWith".
    Using "equals" will search for key values that exactly match the provided string or array of strings.
    Using "contains" will search for key values containing all or part of the provided string or array of strings.
    Using "startsWith" will search key values starting with the provided string or array of strings.
    If no value is specified, the search mode will default to "equals".

  • query.caseSensitive
    Indicates whether the search should be case sensitive or not.
    If true, the search will be case sensitive, and false indicates otherwise.
    If no value is specified, caseSensitive will default to false (that is, the search will be a case-insensitive search).

sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new NodeHierarchy. The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created via a call to {@link sap.ui.vk.Scene#getDefaultNodeHierarchy sap.ui.vk.Scene.getDefaultNodeHierarchy}. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Events
    • {@link #event:changed changed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:nodeCreated nodeCreated} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:nodeRemoving nodeRemoving} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:nodeReplaced nodeReplaced} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:nodeUpdated nodeUpdated} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor sap.ui.base.ManagedObject} can be used as well.

sap.ui.vk.threejs.NodeHierarchy.!description:
Provides the ability to explore a Scene object's node structure.

The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created via a call to {@link sap.ui.vk.Scene#getDefaultNodeHierarchy sap.ui.vk.Scene#getDefaultNodeHierarchy}.

createLayerProxy.!description:
Creates a layer proxy object.

The layer proxy object must be destroyed with the {@link #destroyLayerProxy destroyLayerProxy} method.

parameters.layerId: type: string, description: The layer ID for which to create a proxy object.

createNode.!type: fn(parentNode: THREE.Object3D, name: String, insertBeforeNode: THREE.Object3D) -> THREE.Object3D

parameters.parentNode: type: THREE.Object3D, description: The reference object of the parent node where the created node is added to. If equals null the newly created node is a top level node.
parameters.name: type: string, description: The name of the new node.
parameters.insertBeforeNode: type: THREE.Object3D, description: The created node is added before this specified node. If equals null the newly created node is added at the end of the parent's list of nodes.

getHotspotNodeIds.!description: Returns a list of hotspot IDs.

parameters.nodeProxy: type: sap.ui.vk.NodeProxy, description: The node proxy object.

removeNode.!description: Deletes a node and destroys it.

parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The reference object of a node or an array of nodes to destroy.

enumerateChildren.!description:
Enumerates the child nodes of a particular node in the Scene object. This method gets the child nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function to which it passes the child nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to the callback fuction are temporary objects, which are reset after each call to the callback function.
enumerateChildren.!type: fn(nodeRef: Object, callback: fn(), stepIntoClosedNodes?: Boolean, passNodeRef?: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy

parameters.stepIntoClosedNodes:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to enumerate the child nodes if the node is closed.
If true, the children of that closed node will be enumerated
If false, the children of that node will not be enumerated
parameters.callback: type: function, description: A function to call when the child nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type {@link sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy}, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.
parameters.nodeRef:
type: any, description: The reference object of a node whose child nodes we want enumerated.
When nodeRef is specified, the child nodes of this node are enumerated.
When no nodeRef is specified, only the top level nodes are enumerated.
parameters.passNodeRef:
type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to pass the node references of the child nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the child nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies created from the child node references are passed to the callback function.

createNodeProxy.!description:
Creates a node proxy object.

The node proxy object must be destroyed with the {@link #destroyNodeProxy destroyNodeProxy} method.

parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: The reference object for which to create a proxy object.

The supported settings are:

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.Camera#constructor sap.ui.vk.Camera} can be used as well.

Camera zoom factor

parameters.color: type: int|sap.ui.vk.CSSColor, description: The color to use for highlighting the nodes passed as argument.
parameters.show: type: boolean, description: Whether to highlight the nodes or remove the highlight.
parameters.nodeRefs: type: any|any[], description: The node reference or the array of node references that we want to tint.

getViewInfo.!description: Retrieves information about the current camera view in the scene, and saves the information in a JSON-like object. The information can then be used at a later time to restore the scene to the same camera view using the {@link sap.ui.vk.Viewport#setViewInfo setViewInfo} method.

parameters.query: type: object, description: Query object which indicates what information to be retrieved.

sap.ui.vk.Viewport.!description: Provides a rendering canvas for the 3D elements of a loaded scene.

setViewInfo.!description:
Sets the current scene to use the camera view information acquired from the {@link sap.ui.vk.Viewport#getViewInfo getViewInfo} method.
Internally, the setViewInfo method activates certain steps at certain animation times, and then changes the camera position, rotation and field of view (FOV) / zoom factor.

parameters.flyToDuration: type: float, description: Fly-to animation duration in seconds.
parameters.viewInfo: type: object, description: A JSON-like object containing view information acquired using the {@link sap.ui.vk.Viewport#getViewInfo getViewInfo} method.

zoomTo.!description: Zooms the scene to a bounding box created from a particular set of nodes.
zoomTo.!type: fn(what: [sap.ui.vk.ZoomTo | sap.ui.vk.ZoomTo], nodeRef: Object, crossFadeSeconds: Number, margin: Number) -> sap.ui.vk.Viewport

parameters.what: type: sap.ui.vk.ZoomTo|sap.ui.vk.ZoomTo[], description: What set of nodes to zoom to.
parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: Is only used if what == sap.ui.vk.ZoomTo.Node.
parameters.margin: type: float, description: Margin. Set to 0 to zoom to the entire screen.
parameters.crossFadeSeconds: type: float, description: Time to perform the "fly to" animation. Set to 0 to do this immediately.

tap.!description: Executes a click or tap gesture.
tap.!type: fn(x: Number, y: Number, isDoubleClick: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.Viewport

parameters.isDoubleClick: type: boolean, description: Indicates whether the tap gesture should be interpreted as a double-click. A value of true indicates a double-click gesture, and false indicates a single click gesture.
parameters.y: type: int, description: The tap gesture's y-coordinate.
parameters.x: type: int, description: The tap gesture's x-coordinate.

getImage.!description: Returns viewport content as an image of desired size.
getImage.!type: fn(width: Number, height: Number, topColor: String, bottomColor: String, includeSelection: Boolean) -> String

parameters.height: type: int, description: Requested image height in pixels (allowed values 8 to 2048)
parameters.width: type: int, description: Requested image width in pixels (allowed values 8 to 2048)
parameters.bottomColor: type: string, description: The sap.ui.core.CSSColor to be used for bottom background color
parameters.includeSelection: type: boolean, description: Include selected nodes
parameters.topColor: type: string, description: The sap.ui.core.CSSColor to be used for top background color
