sap.ui.vk.Notifications.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Notifications. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
  • Events
    • {@link #event:allMessagesCleared allMessagesCleared} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:messageAdded messageAdded} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

detachMessageAdded.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:messageAdded messageAdded} event of this sap.ui.vk.Notifications. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

clearAllMessages.!description: Clears the items in the Message Popover list.

sap.ui.vk.Notifications.!description: Provides the ability to display logged console messages within your application.

detachAllMessagesCleared.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:allMessagesCleared allMessagesCleared} event of this sap.ui.vk.Notifications. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

fireAllMessagesCleared.!description: Fires event {@link #event:allMessagesCleared allMessagesCleared} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

sap.ui.vk.threejs.Billboard.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Billboard. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getFont font} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getFontSize fontSize} : float (default: 20)
    • {@link #getFontWeight fontWeight} : string (default: normal)
    • {@link #getFontItalic fontItalic} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTextColor textColor} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: #fff)
    • {@link #getBorderColor borderColor} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: #fff)
    • {@link #getBorderOpacity borderOpacity} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getBackgroundColor backgroundColor} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: #fff)
    • {@link #getBackgroundOpacity backgroundOpacity} : float (default: 0.5)
    • {@link #getEncoding encoding} : sap.ui.vk.BillboardTextEncoding (default: PlainText)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : float (default: 100)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : float (default: 100)
    • {@link #getStyle style} : sap.ui.vk.BillboardStyle (default: None)
    • {@link #getBorderLineStyle borderLineStyle} : sap.ui.vk.BillboardBorderLineStyle (default: Solid)
    • {@link #getBorderWidth borderWidth} : float (default: 2)
    • {@link #getHorizontalAlignment horizontalAlignment} : sap.ui.vk.BillboardHorizontalAlignment (default: Left)
    • {@link #getTexture texture} : any
    • {@link #getMaterial material} : any
    • {@link #getLink link} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getCoordinateSpace coordinateSpace} : sap.ui.vk.BillboardCoordinateSpace (default: Viewport)
    • {@link #getPosition position} : any (default: new THREE.Vector3(0, 0, 0))
    • {@link #getRenderOrder renderOrder} : int (default: 0)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor sap.ui.base.ManagedObject} can be used as well.

sap.ui.vk.threejs.Viewport.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a ThreeJs viewport. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Events
    • {@link #event:cameraChanged cameraChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:frameRenderingFinished frameRenderingFinished} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.ViewportBase#constructor sap.ui.vk.ViewportBase} can be used as well.

getViewInfo.!description: Retrieves information about the current camera view in the scene, and saves the information in a JSON-like object. The information can then be used at a later time to restore the scene to the same camera view using the {@link sap.ui.vk.Viewport#setViewInfo setViewInfo} method.

parameters.query: type: object, description: Query object which indicates what information to be retrieved.

sap.ui.vk.threejs.Viewport.!description: Provides a base class control for three js canvas.

queueCommand.!description: Queues a command for execution during the rendering cycle. All gesture operations should be called using this method.

parameters.command: type: function, description: The command to be executed.

setViewInfo.!description:
Sets the current scene to use the camera view information acquired from the {@link sap.ui.vk.Viewport#getViewInfo getViewInfo} method.
Internally, the setViewInfo method activates certain steps at certain animation times, and then changes the camera position, rotation and field of view (FOV) / zoom factor.

parameters.flyToDuration: type: float, description: Fly-to animation duration in seconds.
parameters.viewInfo: type: object, description: A JSON-like object containing view information acquired using the {@link sap.ui.vk.Viewport#getViewInfo getViewInfo} method.

setScene.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.50.0 undefined
Attaches the scene to the Viewport for rendering.

parameters.scene: type: sap.ui.vk.threejs.Scene, description: The scene to attach to the Viewport.

getImage.!type: fn(width: Number, height: Number, topColor: String, bottomColor: String, includeSelection: Boolean) -> String

parameters.height: type: int, description: Requested image height in pixels. Allowed values are 8 to 2048, default is 16
parameters.width: type: int, description: Requested image width in pixels. Allowed values are 8 to 2048, default is 16
parameters.bottomColor: type: string, description: The sap.ui.core.CSSColor to be used for bottom background color
parameters.includeSelection: type: boolean, description: Include selected nodes
parameters.topColor: type: string, description: The sap.ui.core.CSSColor to be used for top background color

sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager.!description:
Provides a content manager object that uses the three.js library to load 3D files. When registering a content manager resolver with {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector.addContentManagerResolver sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector.addContentManagerResolver} you can pass a function that will load a model and merge it into the three.js scene. The loader function takes two parameters:
  • parentNode - {@link https://threejs.org/docs/index.html#api/objects/Group THREE.Group} - a grouping node to merge the content into
  • contentResource - {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentResource sap.ui.vk.ContentResource} - a content resource to load
The loader function returns a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise Promise} object. If the loading the model succeeds the promise object resolves with a value with the following structure:
  • node - {@link https://threejs.org/docs/index.html#api/objects/Group THREE.Group} - the grouping node to which the content is merged into. It should be the parentNode parameter that was passed to the loader function.
  • contentResource - {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentResource sap.ui.vk.ContentResource} - the content resource that was loaded.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.vk.ContentManager.extend}.

parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata
parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

loadContent.!description:
Starts downloading and building or updating the content from the content resources.

This method is asynchronous.

parameters.content: type: any, description: The current content to update. It can be null if this is an initial loading call.
parameters.contentResources: type: sap.ui.vk.ContentResource[], description: The content resources to load or update.

If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

active.!description: Used to control the tool rendering and interaction pipeline.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. sap.ui.vk.OverlayArea.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new OverlayArea. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getKey key} : string
    • {@link #getPosition position} : string
    • {@link #getColor color} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(200, 50, 50, 0.3))
    • {@link #getColorBorder colorBorder} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(200, 50, 50, 1.0))
    • {@link #getColorSelect colorSelect} : string
    • {@link #getColorNonSelect colorNonSelect} : string
    • {@link #getDeltaColorHot deltaColorHot} : string (default: RHLSA(0;1.3;1.0;1.0))
    • {@link #getSelect select} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getChangeable changeable} : boolean (default: false)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:click click} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contextMenu contextMenu} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:edgeClick edgeClick} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:edgeContextMenu edgeContextMenu} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:handleMoved handleMoved} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:handleContextMenu handleContextMenu} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:handleClick handleClick} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.vk.FlexibleControl.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FlexibleControl. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getLayout layout} : string (default: Stacked)
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

destroyContent.!description: Destroys all the content in the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

getHeight.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHeight height}.

insertContent.!description: Inserts a content into the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property height

setEnabled.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnabled enabled}. If not enabled all controls inside are not enabled automatically. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bEnabled: type: boolean, description: New value for property enabled

getWidth.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}.

CSS width of the vertical layout.

getLayout.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getLayout layout}. Default value is Stacked.

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. CSS width of the vertical layout. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property width

getCameraInfo.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getCameraInfo cameraInfo}.

Object containing camera info (optional) Perspective camera requires: type (String) must be "PerspectiveCamera", fov (Number), position [Array of 3 Numbers], nearClipPlane (Number), farClipPlane (Number), targetDirection - [Array of 3 Numbers], upDirection - [Array of 3 Numbers] Orthographic camera requires: type (String) must be "OrthographicCamera", nearClipPlane (Number), farClipPlane (Number), zoomFactor (Number), position [Array of 3 Numbers], targetDirection - [Array of 3 Numbers], upDirection - [Array of 3 Numbers]

sap.ui.vk.View.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new View. The objects of this class contain neccessary information to reproduce current view including camera type, position and orientation as well as objects visibility property and their positions (if different from default) Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getCameraInfo cameraInfo} : object
    • {@link #getNodeInfos nodeInfos} : object[]
    • {@link #getPlaybacks playbacks} : object[]

parameters.sNodeInfos: type: object[], description: New value for property nodeInfos

setPlaybacks.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPlaybacks playbacks}. Array of objects containing playback information. All required: sequenceId (string), playbackSpeed (float), playbackPreDelay (float), playbackPostDelay (float), playbackRepeat - required (int), playbackReversed (Boolean) When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

sap.ui.vk.tools.AnchorPointTool.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for an AnchorPointTool. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Events
    • {@link #event:moving moving} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:moved moved} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:rotating rotating} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:rotated rotated} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool#constructor sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool} can be used as well.

parameters.vContentResource: type: int|string|sap.ui.vk.ContentResource, description: The contentResource to remove or its index or id

getSourceProperties.!description:
Gets content resource source properties. The content resource source properties depend on the content resource source type. They are different for VDS and PNG for example. The list of possible source properties:
  • version - object
    • major - number
    • minor - number
  • compressed - boolean
  • encrypted - boolean
The source properties are optional and the list might be extended in future versions.

setSourceType.!description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getSourceType sourceType}. The source type of the content resource. Valid types:
  • vds
  • svg
  • png
  • jpg
  • jpeg
  • gif
  • bmp
  • tif
  • tiff
  • stream
The source type may be omitted if this is a grouping content node. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sSourceType: type: string, description: New value for property sourceType

getLocalMatrix.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getLocalMatrix localMatrix}.

The local transformation matrix of the node created for this content resource.

setActivateView.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getActivateView activateView}. Optional parameter with view id which shall be activated when scene is loaded. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sActivateView: type: string, description: New value for property activateView

getPushViewGroups.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getPushViewGroups pushViewGroups}.

If set to true, infomation of view groups will be returned. Default: true.

setMetadataFilter.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMetadataFilter metadataFilter}. Optional metadata filter that can trim the tree before sending to the client only keeping nodes that passed the filter and their parents. Default: null. Format: Comma-separated list of meta.category1.tag1.value1, meta.category2.tag2.value2. "meta." is the prefix and all metadata filters must start with it. Multiple filters are supported, they are combined using `OR` operator. Includes parent nodes of matching nodes (e.g. breadcrumb) even if they dont pass the filter. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sMetadataFilter: type: string, description: New value for property metadataFilter

getSource.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSource source}.

The source URL or the {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File File} object of the content resource/file to load from. The source may be omitted if a grouping node is needed.

parameters.sVeid: type: string, description: New value for property veid

sap.ui.vk.ContentResource.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ContentResource. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSource source} : any
    • {@link #getSourceType sourceType} : string
    • {@link #getSourceId sourceId} : string
    • {@link #getLocalMatrix localMatrix} : sap.ui.vk.TransformationMatrix
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getPassword password} : string
    • {@link #getUseSecureConnection useSecureConnection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getVeid veid} : string
    • {@link #getIncludeHidden includeHidden} : boolean
    • {@link #getIncludeAnimation includeAnimation} : boolean
    • {@link #getPushPMI pushPMI} : boolean
    • {@link #getMetadataFilter metadataFilter} : string
    • {@link #getActivateView activateView} : string
    • {@link #getEnableLogger enableLogger} : boolean
    • {@link #getPushViewGroups pushViewGroups} : boolean
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContentResources contentResources} : sap.ui.vk.ContentResource[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor sap.ui.base.ManagedObject} can be used as well.

Multiple filters are supported, they are combined using `OR` operator. Includes parent nodes of matching nodes (e.g. breadcrumb) even if they dont pass the filter.

sap.ui.vk.Material.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Material. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getId id} : string
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getAmbientColour ambientColour} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(0, 0, 0, 1))
    • {@link #getDiffuseColour diffuseColour} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(0, 0, 0, 1))
    • {@link #getSpecularColour specularColour} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(0, 0, 0, 1))
    • {@link #getEmissiveColour emissiveColour} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(0, 0, 0, 1))
    • {@link #getOpacity opacity} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getGlossiness glossiness} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getLineColour lineColour} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(0, 0, 0, 1))
    • {@link #getLineWidth lineWidth} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getTextureDiffuse textureDiffuse} : sap.ui.vk.Texture
    • {@link #getTextureBump textureBump} : sap.ui.vk.Texture
    • {@link #getTextureOpacity textureOpacity} : sap.ui.vk.Texture
    • {@link #getTextureReflection textureReflection} : sap.ui.vk.Texture
    • {@link #getTextureEmissive textureEmissive} : sap.ui.vk.Texture
    • {@link #getTextureAmbientOcclusion textureAmbientOcclusion} : sap.ui.vk.Texture
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor sap.ui.base.ManagedObject} can be used as well.

setLineWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getLineWidth lineWidth}. Line width (optional) When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

parameters.fLineWidth: type: float, description: New value for property lineWidth

sap.ui.vk.AuthorizationHandler.!description:
Contract for authorization callback function

A callback function which can be implemented by an application to provide an authorization token Such function receives single parameter which is connection URL and must return a promise which will be resolved when authorization token is obtained.

Constructor for a new LayerProxy.

Objects of this type should only be created with the {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#createLayerProxy sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.createLayerProxy} method
and destroyed with the {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#destroyLayerProxy sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.destroyLayerProxy} method.

getNodes.!description: Gets an array of IDs of nodes belonging to the layer.

sap.ui.vk.dvl.LayerProxy.!description:
Provides a proxy object to the layer in the node hierarchy.

Layer is a list of nodes. One node hierarchy can have multiple layers. One node can be included in multiple layers.

Objects of this type should only be created with the {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#createLayerProxy sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.createLayerProxy} method and destroyed with the {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy#destroyLayerProxy sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.destroyLayerProxy} method.

setSelectionState.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.56.3 undefined
Sets the selection state of the nodes.
setSelectionState.!type: fn(nodeRefs: [Object | Object], selected: Boolean, recursive: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager

parameters.selected: type: boolean, description: The new selection state of the nodes.
parameters.recursive: type: boolean, description: The flags indicates if the change needs to propagate recursively to child nodes.
parameters.nodeRefs: type: any|any[], description: The node reference or the array of node references.

getVisibilityState.!description:
Gets the visibility state of nodes. If a single node reference is passed to the method then a single visibility state is returned.
If an array of node references is passed to the method then an array of visibility states is returned.

parameters.nodeRefs: type: any|any[], description: The node reference or the array of node references.

setSelectionStates.!description: Sets or resets the selection state of the nodes.
setSelectionStates.!type: fn(selectedNodeRefs: [Object | Object], unselectedNodeRefs: [Object | Object], recursive: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager

parameters.selectedNodeRefs: type: any|any[], description: The node reference or the array of node references of selected nodes.
parameters.recursive: type: boolean, description: The flags indicates if the change needs to propagate recursively to child nodes.
parameters.unselectedNodeRefs: type: any|any[], description: The node reference or the array of node references of unselected nodes.

setOpacity.!description: Sets the opacity of the nodes.
setOpacity.!type: fn(nodeRefs: [Object | Object], opacity: Number | null, recursive?: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager

parameters.recursive: type: boolean, description: The flags indicates if the change needs to propagate recursively to child nodes.
parameters.opacity: type: float|null, description: The new opacity of the nodes. If null is passed then the opacity is reset and the node's own opacity should be used.
parameters.nodeRefs: type: any|any[], description: The node reference or the array of node references.

sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new NativeViewport. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getLimitZoomOut limitZoomOut} : boolean (default: false)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getContentConnector contentConnector} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:resize resize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:move move} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

pan.!description: Performs a pan gesture to pan across the Viewport.

parameters.dx:: type: int, description: The change in distance along the x-coordinate.
parameters.dy:: type: int, description: The change in distance along the y-coordinate.

getViewInfo.!description: Gets information about the Viewport's attributes; for example, camera.

attachResize.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:resize resize} event of this sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport itself. Raised when the display size of the image in the Native Viewport changes.
attachResize.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport itself

sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport.!description:
Enables loading, pan, zoom and overlay capabilities for a subset of file formats capable of being loaded into a browser natively. 
viewer.loadContent("https://www.google.co.nz/images/srpr/logo11w.png", "png", true);

getContentConnector.!description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getContentConnector contentConnector}, or null.

parameters.oContentConnector: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector, description: ID of an element which becomes the new target of this contentConnector association; alternatively, an element instance may be given

setViewInfo.!description: Sets information about the Viewport's attributes; for example, camera.

setLimitZoomOut.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getLimitZoomOut limitZoomOut}. Limit the abbility to zoom out. If enabled the zoom out stops if the image size reaches 25% of the full view (best fit). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bLimitZoomOut: type: boolean, description: New value for property limitZoomOut

queueCommand.!description: Queues a command for execution during the rendering cycle. All gesture operations should be called using this method.

parameters.command:: type: function, description: The function to be executed.

detachResize.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:resize resize} event of this sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

tap.!description: Executes a click or tap gesture.
tap.!type: fn(x:: Number, y:: Number, isDoubleClick:: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport

parameters.isDoubleClick:: type: boolean, description: Indicates whether the tap gesture should be interpreted as a double-click. A value of true indicates a double-click gesture, and false indicates a single click gesture.
parameters.y:: type: int, description: The tap gesture's y-coordinate.
parameters.x:: type: int, description: The tap gesture's x-coordinate.

endGesture.!description: Marks the end of the current gesture operation.

Enables loading, pan, zoom and overlay capabilities for a subset of file formats capable of being loaded into a browser natively.
